text.text_translated:
Some news says the world is not safe.  
But there is hope.  
Between 1945 and 1990 there were 30 wars.  
Each war killed more than 100,000 people.  
Today there are still wars inside a country.  
Countries live together more peacefully now.  
Attacks by people who use bombs have shot up in recent years.  
Since World War Two, wars have killed people who are not soldiers.  
They have also killed soldiers.  
People are nine times more likely to be killed by crime.  
They are less likely to be killed by fighting.  
The fighting is between groups about who is in charge.  
The number of killings around the world fell a little.  
It was 8 per 100,000 people in 2000.  
It fell to about 5.3 in 2015.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Some news says the world is getting more dangerous.  
But there is hope.  
Between 1945 and 1990 there were 30 wars.  
Each war killed more than 100,000 people.  
Today there are still civil wars.  
Countries live together more peacefully now.  
Attacks by terrorists have shot up in recent years.  
Since World War Two, wars have killed more civilians than soldiers.  
People are nine times more likely to be killed by violent crime than by political conflict.  
The number of killings around the world fell a little.  
It was 8 per 100,000 people in 2000.  
It fell to about 5.3 in 2015.
